intro: Albertisia undulata, commonly known as the undulating albertisia, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, undulating leaves that are adapted to reduce water loss in its harsh environment. Its flowers are typically small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters. Albertisia undulata is often found growing on rocky outcrops and in sandy soils, showcasing its resilience to drought and poor nutrient conditions.
